    • Method Detail

      • winner

        public boolean winner()
        Checks whether the game has a winner or not
        Returns:
        true if the game has a winner, false otherwise

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Checks whether the game is over or not. A game is over when the number of available balls are 0 or the player won the game.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over, false otherwise

      • dropBall

        public void dropBall()
        Reduces the count of available balls.

      • addBall

        public void addBall()
        Increases the count of available balls.

      • getBalls

        public int getBalls()
        Gets the current number of available balls to play.
        Returns:
        number of the available balls

      • updatePoints

        public void updatePoints​(int newPoints)
        Increases the accumulated points
        Parameters:
        newPoints - amount of points to increase

      • getCurrentPoints

        public int getCurrentPoints()
        Gets the accumulated points through all levels and current Level.
        Returns:
        Current points of the Game

      • getCurrentLevel

        Gets the current Level.
        Returns:
        the current level
        See Also:

      • setCurrentLevel

        public void setCurrentLevel​(Level lvl)
        Sets a Level as the current playing level.
        Parameters:
        lvl - the level to be used as the current level
        See Also:
        Level

      • goNextLevel

        public void goNextLevel()
        Pass to the next level of the current Level. Ignores all conditions and skip to the next level.

      • addPlayingLevel

        public void addPlayingLevel​(Level lvl)
        Adds a level to the list of Level to play. This adds the level in the last position of the list.
        Parameters:
        lvl - level to be added

      • update

        public void update​(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
        Update method, called when something change in observed Level
        Update points and ball number then check if level is over.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        o - Observable Object, Level observed.
        arg - Args of update
